forecast.name: Today
forecast.shortForecast: Mostly Cloudy then Light Rain Likely
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain likely after 4pm. Mostly cloudy. High near 53, with temperatures falling to around 51 in the afternoon. West northwest wind 7 to 10 mph. Chance of precipitation is 60%.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain likely before 4am. Mostly cloudy. Low around 43, with temperatures rising to around 45 overnight. Southeast wind 5 to 9 mph. Chance of precipitation is 60%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

weather_report:
The morning unveils a mixture of heavy clouds draping over Downtown San Francisco, weaving a narrative of impending rain. As the clock ticks toward the afternoon, the crisp air turns noticeably colder, promising a descent in temperature to the low fifties. This cloudy canvas hints at the rain that is likely to arrive after four, yet for now, the city glimmers under the soft white of the clouds, the Golden Gate Bridge barely visible in the backdrop, despite the tenuous sun making its efforts known. The breeze carries a gentle chill, instilling a sense of quietude as the southeast winds whisper their way through the streets.

As the day progresses, one might consider dressing in layers, perhaps a warm sweater paired with a light waterproof jacket—perfect for those soon-to-come drizzles. A stroll through the quieter streets, enjoying a newly opened café or delving into a book at a cozy library, feels just right in such weather. While the persistent clouds and the anticipated rain may suggest a day spent indoors, the charm of the city lies in making the most of its rhythms, perhaps indulging in the aroma of freshly brewed coffee or losing oneself in the pages of an engaging story, allowing the soft patter of rain to be the perfect backdrop for a day well spent.
